content.raw:
I’d like to second this request. The manual download \(point & click\) is really tedious. 

The logs are being downloaded in a very strange way. When I click on the respective download button, it seems nothing is happening. But in the background, the log is being downloaded somewhere but there is no indication of speed, size, remaining time, nothing. Only when the file has finished downloading a dialog pops out asking where to save the already downloaded file. Each log can have up to 2GB so you can imagine the frustration of not knowing if it is indeed being downloaded or not.

Last time I’ve spent over an hour babysitting the downloads. Can we please have a scriptable way for the log downloads?
content.html:
I’d like to second this request. The manual download (point & click) is really tedious.

The logs are being downloaded in a very strange way. When I click on the respective download button, it seems nothing is happening. But in the background, the log is being downloaded somewhere but there is no indication of speed, size, remaining time, nothing. Only when the file has finished downloading a dialog pops out asking where to save the already downloaded file. Each log can have up to 2GB so you can imagine the frustration of not knowing if it is indeed being downloaded or not.

Last time I’ve spent over an hour babysitting the downloads. Can we please have a scriptable way for the log downloads?

content.raw: Could this proposal be considered now that the urban circuit is over, before we dive into the cave? Any way that would enable automation of the log downloads would be warmly welcomed.
